item.title: Nintendo Has a Shrewd Plan for Selling the Switch 2 in Japan
item.description: Nintendo Co. is making an unusual move with its Switch 2 distribution in Japan: It’s setting wholesale prices so retailers can earn more from each sale.
item.dc:creator: Takashi Mochizuki

item.title: Apple Developer Event Will Show It’s Still Far From Being an AI Leader
item.description: Apple, a year after debuting its AI platform, will do little at WWDC to show it’s catching up to leaders like OpenAI and Google. Also: The latest macOS gets its new California theme; a look at why the company is moving to an iOS 26 and macOS 26 naming system; and details on Apple’s dedicated gaming app.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: Tim Cook, chief executive officer of Apple Inc., during an event at Apple Park campus in Cupertino, California, US, on Monday, Sept. 9, 2024. Apple Inc. unveiled a new version of its smartwatch with a bigger screen and the ability to detect sleep apnea, part of an event Monday that will also include the iPhone 16 smartphone.

item.title: BYD May Sales Highest This Year After Week of Steep Discounts
item.description: BYD Co.’s sales for May were its best this year after heavy discounts offered during the final days of the month lured customers into showrooms.
item.dc:creator: Katrina Nicholas

media:content.media:description: A BYD Co. logo on an electric vehicle at a dealership in Lisbon, Portugal, on Monday, April 21, 2025. BYD Co. recently launched a car system it says can charge a vehicle for 400 kilometers in about five minutes.

item.title: Southeast Asia Joins Europe’s Calls to Defend Subsea Cables
item.description: Defense officials from Europe and Southeast Asia called for stronger collaboration to protect the global network of subsea cables as concerns grow over threats to this vital infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: Philip Heijmans, Alberto Nardelli
